pull.title: guix: Clean up manifest
pull.body:
This PR cleans up the `contrib/guix/manifest.scm` in the following way:
- Unneeded for a successful build modules have be dropped.
- Some modules have been enhanced with `#:select` clauses, which improves maintainability (see the commit message for details).

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27813](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27813) (guix: Update `python-lief` package to 0.13.1 by hebasto)
* [#27099](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27099) (build: produce a .zip for macOS distribution by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully -static-pie x86_64 bitcoind using GCC and glibc by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

guix: Drop unneeded modules

tree 24dd649dfe7cc4779da2d62349f093f60d1cf195
parent c319f6fcc3c71e2d025bfa03ccd04be7d9dc3101
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1686040641 +0100
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1686046773 +0100

guix: Specify symbols in modules explicitly

This change improves the maintainability of the manifest:
(1) It allows to remove the module when the specified symbols are no
    longer used.
(2) It prevents accidental use of other symbols, such as `bash`
    instead of `bash-minimal`.

events.message:
guix: Specify symbols in modules explicitly

This change improves the maintainability of the manifest:
(1) It allows to remove the module when the specified symbols are no
    longer used.
(2) It prevents accidental use of other symbols, such as `bash`
    instead of `bash-minimal`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,27 +1,27 @@
 (use-modules (gnu packages)
              (gnu packages autotools)
-             (gnu packages bash)
+             ((gnu packages bash) #:select (bash-minimal))
              (gnu packages bison)
-             (gnu packages certs)
-             (gnu packages cdrom)
-             (gnu packages cmake)
+             ((gnu packages certs) #:select (nss-certs))
+             ((gnu packages cdrom) #:select (xorriso))
+             ((gnu packages cmake) #:select (cmake-minimal))
              (gnu packages commencement)
              (gnu packages compression)
              (gnu packages cross-base)
              (gnu packages file)
              (gnu packages gawk)
              (gnu packages gcc)
-             (gnu packages installers)
+             ((gnu packages installers) #:select (nsis-x86_64))
              (gnu packages linux)
comments.body: Would it make sense to add `((gnu packages linux) #:select (util-linux linux-libre-headers-5.15))`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -257,9 +256,6 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
     (build-system cmake-build-system)
     (inputs
      `(("openssl", openssl)))
-    (arguments
-     '(#:configure-flags
-        (list "-DCMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_CURL=TRUE")))

@@ -257,9 +256,6 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
     (build-system cmake-build-system)
     (inputs
      `(("openssl", openssl)))
-    (arguments
-     '(#:configure-flags
-        (list "-DCMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_CURL=TRUE")))

@@ -1,27 +1,27 @@
 (use-modules (gnu packages)
              (gnu packages autotools)
-             (gnu packages bash)
+             ((gnu packages bash) #:select (bash-minimal))
              (gnu packages bison)
-             (gnu packages certs)

-             (gnu packages cmake)
+             ((gnu packages certs) #:select (nss-certs))
+             ((gnu packages cdrom) #:select (xorriso))
+             ((gnu packages cmake) #:select (cmake-minimal))

              (gnu packages linux)

@@ -257,9 +256,6 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
     (build-system cmake-build-system)
     (inputs
      `(("openssl", openssl)))
-    (arguments
-     '(#:configure-flags
-        (list "-DCMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_CURL=TRUE")))

@@ -247,12 +246,13 @@ and abstract ELF, PE and MachO formats.")
     (name "osslsigncode")
     (version "2.5")
     (source (origin
-              (method url-fetch)
comments.body: Is there a good reason for using `git-fetch` beyond being more consistent? Seems like this is just less efficient, because we get and hash the entire repository instead of just an archive. Probably all the other cases should be using `url-fetch` instead, or at least with the exception of the sourceware repository?
